yahtzee

Class YLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • yahtzee.YLogic

  • public class YLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    The YLogic class controls all aspects of the game itself. It initializes all necessary game objects and methods for proper mutation, facilitation and inspection of all game logic variables. Part of the YLogic class are is the nested class Dice which controls all things relating the the game dice. Nested enums are used for special groupings of constants such as the category names in the game scoresheet or the scores of specific categories. YLogic does not handle any input nor does it display any information to the screen. In fact, the YLogic class can not handle any amount of user interaction. Because of this a separate class is necessary to see over the task of interacting with the user. For the benefit of the developer and the user, a nested class called roundData was added to store game data across all rounds. It was with good intentions that this data will make the game easier to play, understand and result in a more enjoyable experience.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  YLogic.Categories
      Assigns a category to a specific number.
      class  YLogic.Dice
      The Dice class object is defining part of the YLogic class.

      Exception that should be thrown when an array that is being used to initialize a category/score array is not of length .
      class  YLogic.roundData
      This class records all useful user data over the course of a game.
      static class  YLogic.Scores
      Assigns a score to categories that have a static score.

        Parameters:

      • playerRoll

        public void playerRoll()
        Represents the player's choice to roll the dice during a round. Will swap the dice with a new roll, keeping any dice the user said to. Will increment the number of rolls and total rolls. Adds the new roll to the list of previous rolls, and last changes the player kept state to false. The change in player state is done as a saftey precaution so the user does not mistakingly roll without keeping dice next roll.

      • endRound

        public void endRound()
        Represents the end of a round in the game. The list of previous rolls will be added to the list of all rolls, then cleared, along with the player kept dice. The dice will be set to a freshly rolled dice array and placed in the newly empty list of previous rolls. The roll number will be set back to one and the total rolls and round number will both be incremented.

      • findDiceScores

        public int[] findDiceScores()
        Find the scores of each and every category depending of the current dice configuration. Will give the scores pack in array form.
        Returns:
        Array of scores for the current dice

      • checkJokerRule

        public boolean checkJokerRule()
        Checks whether the conditions are met for the Joker Rule to be used. According to the Joker Rule: if the Yahtzee category has been picked and the player rolls another Yahtzee, the Yahtzee may be used as a full house, small straight, or large straight if the corresponding upper section has already been filled. Note: Score does not matter for the Yahtzee category.
        Returns:
        True if the Joker Rule can be used. False if not

      • incYahtzeeCount

        public void incYahtzeeCount()
        Checks whether the Yahtzee count can be incremented. If it can be incremented, do it. If not do not do anything. Will only be incremented If the Yahtzee category was picked with a non-zero score.

      • upperTotal

        public int upperTotal()
        Calculates the total score of the upper section. Upper bonus is not added.
        Returns:
        The total score of the upper section without bonus

      • upperBonus

        public int upperBonus()
        Calculates the upper section bonus.
        Returns:
        The upper section bonus

      • lowerTotal

        public int lowerTotal()
        Calculates the total score of the lower section. Lower bonus is not added.
        Returns:
        The total score of the lower section without bonus

      • lowerBonus

        public int lowerBonus()
        Calculates the lower section bonus.
        Returns:
        The lower section bonus

      • grandTotal

        public int grandTotal()
        Calculates the grand total of the whole game. Will be the sum of the upper total and bonus plus the sum of the lower total and bonus.
        Returns:
        The grand total score of the game

      • findStraight

        private int findStraight(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> diceCount)
        Checks for sequential dice in the current dice configuration.
        Parameters:
        diceCount - List of the number of occurrences for each die number
        Returns:
        The number of sequential dice (only 3 or 4 are significant)
